skill.name: cascade-orchestrator
skill.description: Creates sophisticated workflow cascades coordinating multiple micro-skills with sequential pipelines, parallel execution, conditional branching, and Codex sandbox iteration. Enhanced with multi-model routing (Gemini/Codex), ruv-swarm coordination, memory persistence, and audit-pipeline patterns for production workflows.
skill.summary: Creates sophisticated workflow cascades coordinating multiple micro-skills with sequential pipelines...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing YAML/JSON specifications and pseudocode examples for workflow orchestration. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities exist. The static analyzer misidentified documentation patterns (hash values, backtick formatting, model routing examples) as security issues. All 72 reported findings are false positives caused by pattern matching on documentation content.

content.value_statement: Building complex AI workflows requires coordinating multiple models and tools. This skill provides a declarative framework to define cascades with sequential, parallel, and conditional stages that automatically route tasks to the optimal AI model.
actual_capabilities: Define multi-stage workflows with sequential, parallel, and conditional execution patterns
Automatically route tasks to optimal AI models (Claude, Gemini, Codex) based on task requirements
Coordinate parallel task execution via ruv-swarm MCP integration
Implement Codex sandbox iteration with auto-fix for test-driven development
Persist memory across workflow stages for continuous context
Integrate with GitHub for automated CI/CD pipeline workflows
limitations: Requires compatible MCP servers (ruv-swarm, memory, codex) for full functionality
Model routing limited to supported AI platforms (Claude, Gemini, Codex)
Does not execute code directly, generates cascade specifications that other systems execute
Swarm coordination requires properly configured ruv-swarm MCP server

use_cases.title: Automated CI/CD Pipelines
use_cases.description: Create automated testing and deployment cascades that run quality checks, auto-fix failures, and generate pull requests.

use_cases.title: Multi-Model Research Workflows
use_cases.description: Route complex analysis tasks across Claude, Gemini, and Codex based on context size, web grounding, or visual output needs.

use_cases.title: Complete Feature Development
use_cases.description: Orchestrate end-to-end development from research through prototyping, testing, documentation, and deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Cascade
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a cascade that validates data, transforms it, and generates a report using three sequential stages

prompt_templates.title: Parallel Execution
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a cascade that runs code linting, security scanning, and complexity analysis in parallel using swarm coordination

prompt_templates.title: Auto-Fix Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a codex-sandbox cascade that runs comprehensive tests and automatically fixes any failures for up to 5 iterations

prompt_templates.title: Conditional Routing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a cascade that analyzes code quality, then routes to fast deployment for high quality or deep audit for low quality

output_examples.input: Create a cascade that analyzes a legacy codebase, modernizes it with parallel implementations, and creates a PR
output: Stage 2: theater-detection finds all mocks and placeholders
Stage 3: swarm-parallel executes codex-auto and gemini-media simultaneously
Stage 4: codex-sandbox tests all changes with auto-fix
Stage 5: style-audit polishes code to production standards
Stage 6: generate-pr creates pull request with before/after comparison

output_examples.input: Build a data pipeline that extracts from API, validates, transforms, and generates a visualization report
output: Stage 1: Extract data from API endpoint using extract-data skill
Stage 2: Validate data integrity and schema compliance
Stage 3: Transform data using codex-auto for rapid prototyping
Stage 4: Generate visual report with gemini-media
Memory persistence maintains context across all stages

output_examples.input: Create a quality assurance cascade that runs tests, fixes issues automatically, and escalates if needed
output: Stage 1: Run comprehensive test suite via codex-sandbox
Stage 2: For each failed test, auto-fix up to 5 iterations
Stage 3: Apply successful fixes to main codebase
Stage 4: Escalate to user if issues persist after max iterations

best_practices: Start with simple sequential cascades before adding parallel or conditional stages
Define clear model requirements for each stage to enable intelligent routing
Configure appropriate error handling strategies (retry, auto-fix, fallback) for each stage
Use memory persistence for workflows requiring context across multiple stages
anti_patterns: Overloading a single cascade with too many stages instead of breaking into smaller cascades
Ignoring error handling configuration, leading to cascade failures without recovery
Using the wrong model for a task, such as Claude for large context when Gemini megacontext is better
Skipping the codex-sandbox validation stage for production workflows

faq.question: Which AI models are supported for routing?
faq.answer: Claude, Gemini (standard, megacontext, search, media), and Codex (auto, reasoning). Each has specific strengths for different task types.

faq.question: What is the maximum cascade depth?
faq.answer: No hard limit, but recommend keeping cascades under 10 stages. Complex workflows should chain multiple cascades.

faq.question: How does ruv-swarm MCP integrate?
faq.answer: ruv-swarm enables parallel stage execution through mesh topology coordination, memory persistence, and performance tracking.

faq.question: Is my workflow data stored externally?
faq.answer: Workflow definitions are processed locally. Memory persistence uses configured MCP storage. No data is sent to external services without configuration.

faq.question: Why is my cascade not executing?
faq.answer: Ensure required MCP servers are configured (ruv-swarm, memory, codex). Check that referenced micro-skills exist and are accessible.

faq.question: How does this differ from other workflow tools?
faq.answer: Unlike general CI/CD tools, this skill is designed specifically for AI agents with multi-model routing and AI-specific patterns like codex-sandbox iteration.
